choices.B: Ensure Validation 1 is listed before Validation 2
choices.C: Add a server-side condition of P5_MGR is NOT NULL to the employee job validation (Validation 2)
choices.A: Set stop processing to Yes for the P5_MGR is NOT NULL validation (Validation 1)
choices.D: Set Always Execute to No for the P5_MGR employee job validation (Validation 2)

questions.question_text:
Robert has a form page, Page 5, on the EMP table. He has defined two validations.
Validation 1 checks that P5_MGR is not null.
Validation 2 checks that the employee selected in P5_MGR has a job of PRESIDENT or MANAGER.
How can Robert prevent the employee job validation (Validation 2) from firing when the P5_MGR is NOT NULL validation (Validation 1) has failed?

discussion.content: C is correct. just tested it.
Changed my mind. C is correct for this situation, but how generally prevent firing other validations when the first validation fails?
Are you sure about answer C? I think B is best answer

choices.C: Update the List Entry Label for Hedgers to Hedgers &HEDGER_DEFECTS., and similarly for other products.
choices.D: Add &HEDGER_DEFECTS. to User Defined Attribute 01 in the navigation menu for Hedgers, and similarly for other products.
choices.B: Update Template Options and set Display Count to True.
choices.A: Update the Navigation Menu template to be Include Count.

questions.question_text:
Michael has developed an app for tracking product defects. His navigation menu lists each product. He has defined application items and computations to hold the number of defects for each product. For example, for Hedgers, he has defined the application item HEDGER_DEFECTS.
How can Michael add the number of open defects in the navigation menu entries?

choices.A: Set the Column Mapping > Value to "Percentage".
choices.C: Update the query to return percentage values.

questions.question_text:
William has created the chart on the left, which displays values.
He wants to show the chart on the right, which displays percentages.
//IMG//

Which step should William perform to display percentages?

choices.D: You can invoke the feedback page from a modal dialog page
choices.B: When an administrator updates the feedback status, the person logging the feedback is notified
choices.C: A new table is created in your schema to store the feedback for the app
choices.A: Feedback entered into the app can be viewed by developers in Team Development

questions.question_text:
Mary wants to add feedback to an application. She uses the Create Page Wizard, selects Features, and then selects Feedback. The wizard adds a feedback entry to the navigation bar and creates new pages, in her application, under Administration to review and disposition the feedback.
Which statement is true about feedback data?

choices.B: REST Enabled SQL must be enabled in the remote databases' ORDS configuration.
choices.A: Authentication must be done using the OAuth2 Client Credentials flow.
choices.F: The application parsing schema must be REST enabled.
choices.D: A REST Enabled SQL Reference must be created in Shared Components.
choices.E: Authentication can be done using the remote database username and password.
choices.C: A wallet must be defined and configured on the remote database.

discussion.content: BDE. The parsing schema of application does not need to have Rest enabled

questions.question_text: Which three are true about using REST Enabled SQL to access a remote database? (Choose three.)
